original: KÅGSTKÖM, Simon, Fabrikör, Skellefteå, f Skellefteå 25/2 95 av fabr E K o Anna Sundell, gin Greta Falck. Lärov, garvarsk Freiburg Sachsen. Anst fad fma E Kågström Skell, skodon o läder mm, 10—19, inneh dna sed. 20, AB 43, ag dta. Ordf dräts.kamm sed. 32, stdsflm sed. 32, led kraftvksstyr sed. 43. Vkst dir Skellefteåbladets Tryck AB, styr.led Sundsvallsbkns Skell.kont. Frimurare, Odd Fellow, Rotary.
translated: KÅGSTKÖM, Simon, Industrialist, Skellefteå, b. Skellefteå 25/2 1895, son of textile factory owner E K and Anna Sundell, married to Greta Falck. Educated at a tanning school in Freiburg Sachsen. Employed by his father's company E Kågström in Skellefteå, dealing with shoes and leather, from 1910 to 1919, then took over the business. Established AB 1943, acting director. Chairman of the municipal finance committee since 1932, board member of the municipal power plant since 1932. Head director of Skellefteåbladets Tryck AB, board member of Sundsvallsbanken's Skellefteå branch. Member of Freemasons, Odd Fellow, Rotary.

structured.name: Simon Kågstköm
structured.description: Simon Kågstköm was an industrialist born on February 25, 1895 in Skellefteå. He was the son of E Kågström and Anna Sundell, and was married to Greta Falck. Simon received his education at a tanning school in Freiburg Sachsen. He initially worked for his father's company, E Kågström, in Skellefteå, where he was involved in the shoes and leather industry from 1910 to 1919. After taking over the business, he established AB in 1943 and served as the acting director. Simon also held various civic positions, including Chairman of the Municipal Finance Committee and Board Member of the Municipal Power Plant in Skellefteå since 1932. He was an active member of organizations such as Freemasons, Odd Fellow, and Rotary.

career.occupational_title: Board Member of Municipal Power Plant
Board Member of Sundsvallsbanken's Skellefteå Branch
